what: Enrich and Analyze Sovereign-Level Economic Data
title: Enrich and Analyze Sovereign-Level Economic Data
text: Provides consistent set functions enriching analyzing sovereign-level economic data. Economists, data scientists, financial professionals can use package add standardized identifiers, demographic macroeconomic indicators, derived metrics gross domestic product per capita government expenditure shares. package part EconDataverse family packages aimed helping economists financial professionals work sovereign-level economic data.

title: Add GDP to Country Data — add_gdp_column

title: Add GDP to Country Data — add_gdp_column
text: df data frame containing country identifiers. id_column Name column containing country identifiers. id_type Type country identifier. Defaults "iso3_code". date_column Optional. Name column containing dates time-specific data. target_column Name output column. Defaults "gdp". usd Logical. Indicates whether GDP USD local currency. Defaults "TRUE".

text: data frame additional column containing GDP data.

title: Add GDP to Country Data — add_gdp_column
code: # \donttest{ # Add most recent GDP values df <- data.frame(country = c("USA", "CHN", "DEU")) result <- add_gdp_column(df, id_column = "country")  # Add year-specific GDP values df <- data.frame(country = c("USA", "CHN"), year = c(2019, 2020)) result <- add_gdp_column(df, id_column = "country", date_column = "year") # }
